slug: /176
title: "This Week In React #176: useActionState, React Compiler, Million Lint, TanStack, Generative UI, Vinxi, Remix i18n, Next.js security, Typesafe Router, Shopify RN perf, RCTRootViewFactory, iOS Live Activities, Uni Stack, TypeScript, Parcel..."

segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

translations.fr: Bonjour √† tous !
translations.en: Bonjour √† tous !

segments.source_content: This week is difficult to sum up, there's a lot of interesting news and I don't know which to highlight.

translations.fr: Cette semaine est difficile √† r√©sumer, il y a beaucoup d'actualit√©s int√©ressantes et je ne sais pas lesquelles mettre en avant.
translations.en: Cette semaine est difficile √† r√©sumer, il y a beaucoup de nouvelles int√©ressantes et je ne sais pas lesquelles mettre en avant.

segments.source_content: We notably have a sneak peek of a new React core hook replacing the confusing `useFormState`, that even React Native devs will now be able to use now!

translations.fr: Nous avons notamment un aper√ßu d'un nouveau hook React de base rempla√ßant le `useFormState` d√©routant, que m√™me les d√©veloppeurs React Native pourront d√©sormais utiliser !
translations.en: Nous avons notamment un aper√ßu d'un nouveau hook React de base rempla√ßant le `useFormState` confus, que m√™me les d√©veloppeurs React Native pourront d√©sormais utiliser !

segments.source_content: üò¥ Sleep peacefully knowing that Axiom‚Äôs zero-config observability for Vercel projects has you covered.

translations.fr: üò¥ Dormez paisiblement en sachant que l'observabilit√© sans configuration d'Axiom pour les projets Vercel vous couvre.
translations.en: üò¥ Dormez paisiblement sachant que l'observabilit√© sans configuration d'Axiom pour les projets Vercel vous couvre.

segments.source_content:
- Use Axiom's pre-built dashboard for an overview across all your Vercel logs and vitals, drill down to specific projects and deployments, and get insight on how functions are performing with a single click.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) allows you to send logs and events from any part of your Next.js projects - client, edge, or server-side - without any special configuration.
- Easily send structured logs directly from your code and analyze them together with Vercel logs.

translations.fr:
- Utilisez le tableau de bord pr√©construit d'Axiom pour une vue d'ensemble de tous vos journaux et indicateurs Vercel, explorez des projets et d√©ploiements sp√©cifiques, et obtenez des insights sur les performances des fonctions en un clic.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) vous permet d'envoyer des journaux et √©v√©nements depuis n'importe quelle partie de vos projets Next.js - c√¥t√© client, edge ou serveur - sans configuration sp√©ciale.
- Envoyez facilement des journaux structur√©s directement depuis votre code et analysez-les avec vos journaux Vercel.
translations.en:
- Utilisez le tableau de bord pr√©construit d'Axiom pour une vue d'ensemble de tous vos logs et m√©triques Vercel, explorez des projets et d√©ploiements sp√©cifiques, et obtenez des insights sur les performances des fonctions en un clic.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) vous permet d'envoyer des logs et √©v√©nements depuis n'importe quelle partie de vos projets Next.js - client, edge ou serveur - sans configuration sp√©ciale.
- Envoyez facilement des logs structur√©s depuis votre code et analysez-les avec vos logs Vercel.

segments.source_content: Axiom efficiently captures 100% of your event data so you‚Äôll never have to worry about sampling or retention, and you‚Äôll never have to guess what your users are experiencing.

translations.fr: Axiom capture efficacement 100% de vos donn√©es d'√©v√©nements, vous n'aurez donc jamais √† vous soucier de l'√©chantillonnage ou de la r√©tention, et vous ne devinerez plus ce que vivent vos utilisateurs.
translations.en: Axiom capture efficacement 100% de vos donn√©es √©v√©nementielles, vous n'aurez jamais √† vous soucier d'√©chantillonnage ou de r√©tention, et ne devinerez plus ce que vivent vos utilisateurs.

segments.source_content: [![React Core PR - New useActionState hook](/emails/issues/176/useActionState.jpg)](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28491)

translations.fr: [![PR React Core - Nouveau hook useActionState](/emails/issues/176/useActionState.jpg)](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28491)
translations.en: [![PR React Core - Nouveau hook useActionState](/emails/issues/176/useActionState.jpg)](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28491)

segments.source_content: **[React Core PR - New useActionState hook](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28491)**

translations.fr: **[PR React Core - Nouveau hook useActionState](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28491)**
translations.en: **[PR React Core - Nouveau hook useActionState](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28491)**

segments.source_content: It turns out the useFormState hook was confusing, and not even meant to be solely used in forms. The React team is addressing this by introducing a new React core hook to replace it:

translations.fr: Il s'av√®re que le hook useFormState √©tait d√©routant, et n'√©tait m√™me pas destin√© √† √™tre utilis√© uniquement dans des formulaires. L'√©quipe React r√©sout cela en introduisant un nouveau hook de base pour le remplacer :

en.translation: Il s'av√®re que le hook `useFormState` √©tait source de confusion, et n'√©tait m√™me pas destin√© √† √™tre utilis√© uniquement dans des formulaires. L'√©quipe React r√©sout ce probl√®me en introduisant un nouveau hook de base pour le remplacer :
en.reason: The number of special elements (links, code, variables) differs. Source has 0, translation has 1.

segments.source_content:
- Renames `useFormState` to `useActionState`
- Adds a pending state to the returned tuple
- Moves the hook to the `react` package

translations.fr:
- Renomme `useFormState` en `useActionState`
- Ajoute un √©tat pending au tuple retourn√©
- D√©place le hook vers le package `react`
translations.en:
- Renomme `useFormState` en `useActionState`
- Ajoute un √©tat pending au tuple retourn√©
- D√©place le hook vers le package `react`

segments.source_content: Moving it from `react-dom` to `react` also means that now, other renderers such as React Native can use it too. There are other benefits to look at, such as a ‚Äúpartial progressive enhancement‚Äù feature, but also new caveats documented in the PR.

translations.fr: Le d√©placer de `react-dom` vers `react` signifie √©galement que d'autres moteurs de rendu comme React Native peuvent d√©sormais l'utiliser. Il y a d'autres avantages √† consid√©rer, comme une fonctionnalit√© d'"am√©lioration progressive partielle", mais aussi de nouvelles mises en garde document√©es dans la PR.
translations.en: Le d√©placer de `react-dom` vers `react` signifie √©galement que d'autres moteurs de rendu comme React Native pourront d√©sormais l'utiliser. D'autres avantages existent, comme une fonctionnalit√© de "progressive enhancement partiel", mais aussi de nouvelles mises en garde document√©es dans la PR.

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Secure your documents with PDF Redaction. Discover how to protect sensitive information in PDFs using React. Visit our blog to learn more.](https://apryse.com/blog/pdf-redaction-using-react?utm_source=this%20week%20in%20react&utm_medium=newsletter3)
- üê¶ [React 19 != React Compiler](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1764950877620654474): The React Labs post is a bit ambiguous and misled many of us, so let‚Äôs clarify. The compiler will likely come after the React 19.0 release as a separate project, and there‚Äôs a good chance it will initially be released as a Babel/TypeScript plugin. The internals are decoupled through, so it shouldn‚Äôt take long to adapt it it to Rust.
- üê¶ [TanStack Start preview](https://twitter.com/tannerlinsley/status/1765120904370307438): Tanner works on a TanStack Start full-stack framework based on Vinxi and TanStack Router. This preview shows he‚Äôs migrating his own TanStack site to it.
- üìú [Vercel - Introducing AI SDK 3.0 with Generative UI support](https://vercel.com/blog/ai-sdk-3-generative-ui): With the AI SDK 3.0 and thanks to React Server Components, you can now stream UI components directly from LLMs. Super impressive demos!
- üìú [Secure statically rendered paid content in Next.js (with the App Router)](https://www.ericburel.tech/blog/static-paid-content-app-router): Shows that using Next.js layouts for authentication is not super secure, and the protected content can still leak through the RSC endpoint. Suggests using a middleware instead.
- üìú [Internationalization with Remix](https://remix.run/blog/remix-i18n): Goes back to i18n fundamentals, and then detail various i18n solutions you can set up within Remix. Optional route segments can help you use localized sub-directories.
- üìú [Did you know you can write your own typesafe React router in 500 lines?](https://sinja.io/blog/build-typesafe-react-router-from-scratch): A great comprehensive article that might give you a better understanding of how existing routers work. Also great to learn about advanced TypeScript type-level programming techniques.
- üìú [Streaming HTML out of order without JavaScript](https://lamplightdev.com/blog/2024/01/10/streaming-html-out-of-order-without-javascript/): This super interesting demo shows we don‚Äôt need JavaScript to stream out-of-order HTML chunks, and yet render them in the correct order. All you need is Declarative Shadow DOM and slots. It will be interesting to see if RSC streaming + Suspense could leverage that technique in the future instead of inlining JavaScript.
- üìú [Simple RSC With Vinxi](https://www.brenelz.com/posts/simple-rsc-with-vinxi/): The Vinxi SDK helps you create your own full-stack framework, and it even has a plugin for React Server Components support!
- üìú [Million.js - Blocks with noSlot Mode](https://million.dev/blog/block-noSlot): the Million compiler might wrap your components with `<slot>` elements, which might cause issues (styling). This introduces a new experimental `noSlot` mode..
- üìú [How to add Monaco to a Next.js app to enable custom user workflows](https://deno.com/blog/monaco-nextjs): Interesting tutorial that also shows how to deploy untrusted user code to Deno.
- üìú [Conceptual Model of React and RSC](https://ondrejvelisek.github.io/conceptual-model-of-react-and-rsc/): Reflects around the UI=f(state) formula in interesting ways, and concludes RSC kind of breaks the original model.
- üìú [Why React Server Components Are Breaking Builds to Win Tomorrow](https://www.builder.io/blog/why-react-server-components)
- üìú [The End Of My Gatsby Journey](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2024/03/end-of-gatsby-journey/)
- üìú [React Admin March 2024 Update](https://marmelab.com/blog/2024/03/05/react-admin-march-2024-update.html)
- üì¶ [Million Lint - public beta](https://million.dev/blog/lint): A VSCode extension that helps you keep your React code fast thanks to dynamic analysis. Much simpler to use than React Devtools flame graphs. There will be an additional AI-based Lint++ paid service built on top to suggest you possible performance improvements.
- üì¶ [react-unforget - A compiler for automatic optimization of React apps](https://github.com/mohebifar/react-unforget): After Forgetti, this is another new alternative React compiler coming from the community. See also üê¶ [Joe Savona‚Äôs feedback](https://twitter.com/en_JS/status/1763593971224494106).
- üì¶ [Remix 2.8 - Pass resolved viteConfig to buildEnd hook](https://remix.run/docs/en/main/start/changelog#v280)
- üì¶ [React Query 5.25 - skipToken, typesafe query disabling](https://github.com/TanStack/query/releases/tag/v5.25.0)
- üì¶ [TanStack Router 1.18 - route groups](https://github.com/TanStack/router/releases/tag/v1.18.0)
- üì¶ [Starlight 0.21 - New UI components: Steps, FileTree](https://starlight.astro.build/guides/components/)
- üì¶ [Storybook 8.0 RC - v8 is officially stable enough to be used in production](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/releases/tag/v8.0.0-rc.0)
- üì¶ [Onborda - Onboarding wizard flow for Next.js powered by Framer Motion](https://github.com/uixmat/onborda)
- üì¶ [Input-OTP - One-time password input component for React](https://input-otp.rodz.dev/)
- üì¶ [Panda 0.33](https://github.com/chakra-ui/panda/discussions/2274)
- üì¶ [UVCanvas - React component library for beautifully shaded canvas](https://uvcanvas.com)
- üé• [Jack Herrington - Is Tanstack Router Better Than React-Router?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOwnQJOClrw)
- üé• [Theo - How Shadcn/ui Actually Works](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AqmMx_JidGo)

translations.en: Clerk simplifie l'authentification et la gestion des utilisateurs pour les applications React, garantissant une configuration rapide pour le web moderne.

- üì¶ SDKs for React, React Native, Next.js, Redwood, Remix, and other frameworks
- ‚ö° Integrations with Firebase, Supabase, Convex, and other BaaS providers

- üì¶ SDKs pour React, React Native, Next.js, Redwood, Remix et autres frameworks
- ‚ö° Int√©grations avec Firebase, Supabase, Convex et autres fournisseurs BaaS

- üíÖ Composants d'interface pr√©d√©finis pour la connexion, l'inscription, les profils utilisateurs et les organisations. Personnalisez avec n'importe quelle biblioth√®que CSS et d√©ployez sur votre domaine

segments.source_content: This section is now co-authored with [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt). Feel free to send us your comments by email or on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt)!

translations.fr: Cette section est d√©sormais co-√©crite avec [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt). N'h√©sitez pas √† nous envoyer vos commentaires par email ou sur [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt) !
translations.en: Cette section est d√©sormais co-√©crite avec [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt). N'h√©sitez pas √† nous envoyer vos commentaires par email ou sur [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt) !

segments.source_content: [![Improving Shopify App‚Äôs Performance](/emails/issues/176/shopify.jpg)](https://shopify.engineering/improving-shopify-app-s-performance)

translations.fr: [![Am√©lioration des performances de l'application Shopify](/emails/issues/176/shopify.jpg)](https://shopify.engineering/improving-shopify-app-s-performance)
translations.en: [![Am√©lioration des performances de l'application Shopify](/emails/issues/176/shopify.jpg)](https://shopify.engineering/improving-shopify-app-s-performance)

segments.source_content: **[Improving Shopify App‚Äôs Performance](https://shopify.engineering/improving-shopify-app-s-performance)**

translations.fr: **[Am√©lioration des performances de l'application Shopify](https://shopify.engineering/improving-shopify-app-s-performance)**
translations.en: **[Am√©lioration des performances de l'application Shopify](https://shopify.engineering/improving-shopify-app-s-performance)**

segments.source_content: Shopify has been a proponent of React Native for a long time. But they did notice their app performance go down since they migrated to React Native. Instead of blaming the tech stack, they got to work and started optimizing for performance. The results speak for themselves: App launch is 44 % faster and screen load times were reduced by 59 %. Here‚Äôs a quick summary of some of the measures they took (hint: FlashList plays a big role in some of these). For details, read their great summary post:

translations.fr: Shopify est un partisan de React Native depuis longtemps. Mais ils ont constat√© une baisse des performances de leur application depuis leur migration vers React Native. Plut√¥t que de bl√¢mer la stack technique, ils se sont mis au travail et ont commenc√© √† optimiser les performances. Les r√©sultats parlent d'eux-m√™mes : le lancement de l'application est 44 % plus rapide et les temps de chargement des √©crans ont √©t√© r√©duits de 59 %. Voici un r√©sum√© rapide de certaines mesures qu'ils ont prises (indice : FlashList joue un r√¥le important dans certaines). Pour les d√©tails, lisez leur excellent article de synth√®se :
translations.en: Shopify est un partisan de React Native depuis longtemps. Mais ils ont constat√© une baisse des performances de leur application depuis leur migration vers React Native. Plut√¥t que de bl√¢mer la pile technologique, ils se sont attel√©s √† optimiser les performances. Les r√©sultats parlent d'eux-m√™mes : le lancement de l'application est 44% plus rapide et les temps de chargement des √©crans ont √©t√© r√©duits de 59%. Voici un r√©sum√© rapide des mesures prises (indice : FlashList joue un r√¥le majeur dans certaines). Pour les d√©tails, lisez leur excellent article de synth√®se :

segments.source_content:
- Initially, only render what‚Äôs visible on the screen (especially true for the home screen)
- Build all screens as lists (based on FlashList)
- Use inlineRequires
- Batch state changes
- Optimize caching

translations.fr:
- Rendre initialement uniquement ce qui est visible √† l'√©cran (surtout pour l'√©cran d'accueil)
- Construire tous les √©crans sous forme de listes (bas√©es sur FlashList)
- Utiliser inlineRequires
- Regrouper les changements d'√©tat
- Optimiser la mise en cache
translations.en:
- Rendre initialement uniquement ce qui est visible √† l'√©cran (particuli√®rement vrai pour l'√©cran d'accueil)
- Construire tous les √©crans sous forme de listes (bas√©es sur FlashList)
- Utiliser inlineRequires
- Regrouper les changements d'√©tat
- Optimiser la mise en cache

segments.source_content: Very interesting insights and impressive results. I hope the Shopify team keeps sharing these details and maybe we‚Äôll even see some of the things they mentioned they built during this process ending up as Open Source?

translations.fr: Des insights tr√®s int√©ressants et des r√©sultats impressionnants. J'esp√®re que l'√©quipe Shopify continuera √† partager ces d√©tails et que nous verrons peut-√™tre certaines des solutions qu'ils ont d√©velopp√©es devenir open source ?
translations.en: Des informations tr√®s int√©ressantes et des r√©sultats impressionnants. J'esp√®re que l'√©quipe Shopify continuera √† partager ces d√©tails et peut-√™tre verrons-nous certaines des solutions d√©velopp√©es pendant ce processus devenir open source ?

- üìú [iOS Live Activities and React Native - leveraging the latest iOS features to display your app's most current data without needing to open it](https://www.reactnative.university/blog/live-activities-unleashed): Way more apps should have Live Activities! There is a hurdle for RN devs though, because they need to be written in Swift. This 3-part series walks through all the steps required to add a Live Activity.
